item.title: Imperative vs Declarative Code
item.description: Imperative vs Declarative code The most fundamental difference between imperative and declarative code is that imperative code tells the computer how to achieve a certain goal, while declarative code tells the computer what a certain goal is, and the computer will achieve that goal for you. Another way to conceptualize this is that with declarative code, the computer “knows” what the goal is, while with imperative code, the computer doesn’t know what the end goal is, and is simply following your instructions.
